intro: Oscularia caulescens, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often opening in the morning. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many climbing and trailing plants. Oscularia caulescens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
